question: The number of atoms in 4.5 g of a face-centred cubic crystal with edge length 300 pm is:
(Given density <katex>$=10~g~cm^{-3}$</katex> and <katex>$N_{A}=6.022\times10^{23})$</katex>. [cite: 296-297]
explanation: Volume = <katex>$(300 \times 10^{-10})^3$</katex> cm<katex>$^3$</katex>. Mass = Density x Volume. This approach finds Molar mass. Alternatively, use simple density formula to find number of atoms. Number of atoms <katex>$= \frac{4.5 \times 4}{a^3 \times d} = \frac{18}{(3\times 10^{-8})^3 \times 10} \approx 6.6 \times 10^{22}$</katex>. [cite: 304, 305]
